ac.soton.gdp.lifeguide

Class Strategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • ac.soton.gdp.lifeguide.Strategy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockedRandomisation, Minimisation, SimpleRandomisation

    public abstract class Strategy
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the superclass for any allocation strategy algorithm to be implemented. Provides a static unified invocation of the methods of any of its subclasses.
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    Aleksandar Botev (ab9g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Dionisio Perez-Mavrogenis (dpm3g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Liam de Valmency (lpdv1g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Kim Svensson (ks6g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    See Also:
    TrialDefinition, Participant, DBConnector

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static int allocate(java.lang.String trialName,
           int participantId,
           DBConnector dbConnector)
                    throws AllocationException
        The method allocates a participant of the trial to a treatment. The method is static and synchronous globally through ReentrantLock. This is the only method that should be invoked for allocation regardless of the actual implementation class of the strategy algorithm.
        Parameters:
        trialName - The simple name of the trial, registered at the data source.
        participantId - The ID of the participant which is to be allocated.
        dbConnector - A reference to an implementation of the DBConnector interface
        Returns:
        int representing the allocated arm number, starting from 0 or -1 if it was not possible to allocate the patient to any treatment. This is used when all the treatments have reached their limit of participant and the trial should be terminated.
        Throws:
        AllocationException - if something goes wrong while allocating. A meaningful message should be returned.

      • getRequiredParameters

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRequiredParameters(java.lang.Class<? extends Strategy> cls)
        Parameters:
        cls - The concrete class of the strategy implementation querying about.
        Returns:
        The names of all the parameters for that class that need to be provided in the TrialDefinition object. If no parameters are to be required should return an empty List.

      • getStoredParameters

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float> getStoredParameters(java.lang.Class<? extends Strategy> cls,
                                                                  TrialDefinition trialDefinition)
        Parameters:
        cls - The concrete class of the strategy implementation querying about.
        Returns:
        The names of all the fixed parameters for that class that need to be stored on the data source, mapped to their default values. If no parameters are to be stored should return an empty Map.
